lines.text: You know, Campbell, you're not thinking straight. Since you became a big man, you have the idea that everything should be done the way you want it, and that's dangerous. Better straighten yourself out before someone does it for you.
When I invite a man to my house, I expect him to act like a gentleman.

[seeing Campbell standing over a dead Grinnel]
I thought Grinnel was your friend?
That's what makes it so sad. I've known him for years. First time I was ever forced to kill a man, and it had to be a friend of mine.

[just prior to a shootout]
Make your first shot count, Drucker!

[to the wounded sheriff]
We need a drink. I don't believe in bottled bravery, but this will tone us all up.
